alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Eastern Hanover; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Western Essex; Western King William; Western King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 2:52PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern King and Queen, east central Hanover, central King William and south central Essex Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 252 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Manquin, or 7 miles west of King William, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds to around 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Manquin around 300 PM EDT. King William and Aylett around 315 PM EDT. Saint Stephens Church, Millers Tavern and Stevensville around 330 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Enfield, Central Garage, Owenton, Upshaw, Ino, Walkerton, Biscoe, Rumford, Crouch and Henley Fork. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
